exception.description: Describes the exception members that allow you to conditionally exclude requests from inspection.

anyHeaderCookieOrParam.description: The list of request attributes to treat as rule or attack group exceptions. The possible values are `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, and `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header. Use this option if you can't get an exhaustive list of elements to exclude or the list is too large. You can exclude several attributes.

headerCookieOrParamValues.description: The list of excepted values in headers, cookies, or query parameters.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNameValue.description: Contains details about the excepted name-value pair in a request.

name.description: The name of the request attribute.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name-value pair. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

value.description: The value of the request attribute.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNames.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute name.

names.description: The list of request attribute names.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamPrefix.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute name prefix.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name prefix. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

specificHeaderCookieParamXmlOrJsonNames.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute names. This is only available for attack groups and when advanced exception is not enabled.

names.description: Lists request attribute names, required with several `selector` options. With `wildcard` enabled, `*` represents a sequence and `?` represents any single character. For example, `*` matches any name, and `*session` matches a subset.

selector.description: The request attribute to exclude from inspection. The following selectors require a set of `names`: `ARGS_NAMES`, `ARGS`, `REQUEST_HEADERS_NAMES`, `REQUEST_HEADERS`, `REQUEST_COOKIES_NAMES`, `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_NAMES`, `JSON_PAIRS`, and `XML_PAIRS`. See [Exception selector values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/exception-selector-values).

wildcard.description: Whether you can include `*` and `?` as wildcards in any `names`.

400.description: [Invalid](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/400). Client error, such as invalid or malformed input.

example.detail: The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.
example.title: Bad Request

schema.description: Describes the conditions and exceptions you can configure in attack groups or rules. When `advanced` is enabled, you can only specify attack group exception data in one `basic` or `advancedExceptions` section, and not both.

advancedExceptions.description: Describes the advanced exception members that allow you to conditionally exclude requests from inspection. This is only available for attack groups and when the advanced exception feature is enabled.

conditionOperator.description: Use `OR` to match any condition, or `AND` to match on all conditions.

conditions.description: The list of match conditions.

items.description: Describes what conditions can be set for an action to occur.

caseSensitive.description: Whether to consider the case-sensitivity of the provided query parameter `value`. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

extensions.description: The file extensions that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `extensionMatch` condition `type`.

filenames.description: The filenames that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `filenameMatch` condition `type`.

header.description: The HTTP header that triggers the condition. This only applies to the `requestHeaderMatch` condition `type`.

hosts.description: The hostnames that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `hostMatch` condition `type`.

ips.description: The IPs that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `ipMatch` condition `type`.

methods.description: The HTTP request methods that trigger the condition. The possible values are `GET`, `POST`, `HEAD`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `OPTIONS`, `TRACE`, `CONNECT` and `PATCH`. This only applies to the `requestMethodMatch` condition `type`.

paths.description: The paths that trigger the condition. This only applies to the  `pathMatch` condition `type`.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the condition should trigger on a match (`true`) or a lack of match (`false`).

type.description: The condition type to match on. See [Export condition type values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/etval).

useHeaders.description: Whether the condition should include `X-Forwarded-For` (XFF) header. This only applies to the `ipMatch` condition `type`.

value.description: The query parameter value if the condition `type` is `uriQueryMatch` and header value if the condition `type` is `requestHeaderMatch`. This only applies when the condition `type` is `uriQueryMatch` or `requestHeaderMatch`.

valueWildcard.description: Whether the provided header `value` is a wildcard. This only applies to the `requestHeaderMatch` condition `type`.

wildcard.description: Whether the provided query parameter `value` is a wildcard. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

get.description: List the evaluation hostnames for a configuration version. Evaluation mode for hostnames is only available for Web Application Protector. Run hostnames in evaluation mode to see how your configuration settings protect traffic for that hostname before adding a hostname directly to a live configuration. Once you begin, the hostnames you evaluate start responding to traffic as if they are your current hostnames. However, instead of taking an action the evaluation hostnames log which action they would have taken if they were your actively-protected hostnames and not a test. _Products:_ Web Application Protector, App & API Protector.
get.summary: List evaluation hostnames for a security policy

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successful response.

schema.description: Contains a list of evaluation hostnames for the specified configuration version.

items.description: The hostnames on which to match the request.

mode.description: The type of update you want to make to the evaluation hostname list. You can `append` additional hostnames, `remove` hostnames from the list, or `replace` the existing list with the hostnames you pass in your request.

get.description: __Beta__. Returns the penalty box settings for a security policy in evaluation mode. When the penalty box is enabled for a policy, clients that trigger a Web Application Firewall deny action are placed in the penalty box. There, the action you select for penalty box (either `alert` or `deny`) continues to apply to any requests from that client for the next 10 minutes. _Products:_ All.
get.summary: Get the penalty box for a policy in evaluation mode

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully retrieved penalty box protection settings for a security policy in evaluation mode.

schema.description: Contains action settings for penalty box protection.

oneOf.description: The action to take when penalty box protection is triggered: `alert` to record the trigger event, `abort` to block the request, or `none` to take no action. Ignored if `penaltyBoxProtection` is set to `false`.
oneOf.title: action

oneOf.description: The custom deny action to take when penalty box protection is triggered: `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to execute a custom deny action. Ignored if `penaltyBoxProtection` is set to `false`.
oneOf.title: custom action

penaltyBoxProtection.description: Specifies whether penalty box protection is enabled for the security policy. When set to `true` the `action` occurs if triggered by a request.

get.description: List the conditions and exceptions for a rule you want to evaluate. This operation returns the same object type as other condition and exception operations. Keep in mind that the response for this operation applies to the rules you're evaluating even though the concept of conditions and exceptions is the same for all condition exception endpoints. _Products:_ Kona Site Defender, App & API Protector with the Advanced Security module.
get.summary: Get the conditions and exceptions for an evaluation rule

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully retrieved the rule conditions and exceptions.

schema.description: The GET Response JSON for eval conditions and exceptions.

conditions.description: The conditions list of a rule or attack group.

items.description: Describes what conditions can be set for an action to occur.

caseSensitive.description: Whether to consider the case-sensitivity of the provided query parameter `value`. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

extensions.description: The file extensions that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `extensionMatch` condition `type`.

filenames.description: The filenames that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `filenameMatch` condition `type`.

header.description: The HTTP header that triggers the condition. This only applies to the `requestHeaderMatch` condition `type`.

hosts.description: The hostnames that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `hostMatch` condition `type`.

ips.description: The IPs that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `ipMatch` condition `type`.

methods.description: The HTTP request methods that trigger the condition. The possible values are `GET`, `POST`, `HEAD`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `OPTIONS`, `TRACE`, `CONNECT` and `PATCH`. This only applies to the `requestMethodMatch` condition `type`.

name.description: The query parameter name that triggers the condition. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

nameCase.description: Whether to consider the case-sensitivity of the provided query parameter `name`. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

paths.description: The paths that trigger the condition. This only applies to the  `pathMatch` condition `type`.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the condition should trigger on a match (`true`) or a lack of match (`false`).

type.description: The condition type to match on. See [Export condition type values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/etval).

useHeaders.description: Whether the condition should include `X-Forwarded-For` (XFF) header. This only applies to the `ipMatch` condition `type`.

value.description: The query parameter value if the condition `type` is `uriQueryMatch` and header value if the condition `type` is `requestHeaderMatch`. This only applies when the condition `type` is `uriQueryMatch` or `requestHeaderMatch`.

valueCase.description: Whether to consider the case-sensitivity of the provided header `value`. This only applies to the `requestHeaderMatch` condition `type`.

valueWildcard.description: Whether the provided header `value` is a wildcard. This only applies to the `requestHeaderMatch` condition `type`.

wildcard.description: Whether the provided query parameter `value` is a wildcard. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

exception.description: Describes the exception members that allow you to conditionally exclude requests from inspection.

anyHeaderCookieOrParam.description: The list of request attributes to treat as rule or attack group exceptions. The possible values are `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, and `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header. Use this option if you can't get an exhaustive list of elements to exclude or the list is too large. You can exclude several attributes.

headerCookieOrParamValues.description: The list of excepted values in headers, cookies, or query parameters.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNameValue.description: Contains details about the excepted name-value pair in a request.

name.description: The name of the request attribute.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name-value pair. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

value.description: The value of the request attribute.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNames.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute name.

names.description: The list of request attribute names.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamPrefix.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute name prefix.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name prefix. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

specificHeaderCookieParamXmlOrJsonNames.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute names. This is only available for attack groups and when advanced exception is not enabled.

names.description: Lists request attribute names, required with several `selector` options. With `wildcard` enabled, `*` represents a sequence and `?` represents any single character. For example, `*` matches any name, and `*session` matches a subset.

selector.description: The request attribute to exclude from inspection. The following selectors require a set of `names`: `ARGS_NAMES`, `ARGS`, `REQUEST_HEADERS_NAMES`, `REQUEST_HEADERS`, `REQUEST_COOKIES_NAMES`, `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_NAMES`, `JSON_PAIRS`, and `XML_PAIRS`. See [Exception selector values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/exception-selector-values).

wildcard.description: Whether you can include `*` and `?` as wildcards in any `names`.

400.description: [Invalid](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/400). Client error, such as invalid or malformed input.

example.detail: The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.
example.title: Bad Request

put.description: Update an evaluation rule's conditions and exceptions. When the conditions are met, the rule's actions are ignored and not applied to that specific traffic. The rule action you update with this operation is for a rule you are evaluating and not a rule currently in use for your site or app. _Products:_ Kona Site Defender, App & API Protector with the Advanced Security module.
put.summary: Modify the conditions and exceptions for an evaluation rule

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

schema.description: The PUT Request JSON for eval conditions and exceptions.

advancedExceptions.description: Describes the advanced exception members that allow you to conditionally exclude requests from inspection. This is only available for attack groups and when the advanced exception feature is enabled.

anyHeaderCookieOrParam.description: The list of request attributes to treat as rule or attack group exceptions. The possible values are `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, and `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header. Use this option if you can't get an exhaustive list of elements to exclude or the list is too large. You can exclude several attributes.

headerCookieOrParamValues.description: The list of excepted values in headers, cookies, or query parameters.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNameValue.description: Contains details about the excepted name-value pair in a request.

name.description: The name of the request attribute.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name-value pair. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

value.description: The value of the request attribute.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNames.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute name.

names.description: The list of request attribute names.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamPrefix.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute name prefix.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name prefix. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

specificHeaderCookieParamXmlOrJsonNames.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute names. This is only available for attack groups and when advanced exception is not enabled.

names.description: Lists request attribute names, required with several `selector` options. With `wildcard` enabled, `*` represents a sequence and `?` represents any single character. For example, `*` matches any name, and `*session` matches a subset.

selector.description: The request attribute to exclude from inspection. The following selectors require a set of `names`: `ARGS_NAMES`, `ARGS`, `REQUEST_HEADERS_NAMES`, `REQUEST_HEADERS`, `REQUEST_COOKIES_NAMES`, `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_NAMES`, `JSON_PAIRS`, and `XML_PAIRS`. See [Exception selector values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/exception-selector-values).

wildcard.description: Whether you can include `*` and `?` as wildcards in any `names`.

get.description: Lists which network lists are used in the IP/Geo Firewall settings. In Control Center this method is called `mode`. In this API the method is called `blocked`. The response shows blocked and allowed IPs depending on which network lists you include and which version of the mode you choose. If you want to add or remove IP addresses from the network lists, use the [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api). Note that subnet controls are a legacy item in Control Center and are not available through this API. _Products:_ All.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully retrieved the IP/Geo firewall settings.

schema.description: The GET Response JSON for IP Geo Firewall.

block.description: The method by which you block or allow requests by IP or geographic location. In Control Center, this is called `mode`. Use `blockSpecificIPGeo` to block any IPs, subnets, geographies, or network lists you specify. Use `blockAllTrafficExceptAllowedIPs` to allow requests from IPs, subnets, geographies or networks lists in your `blockExceptions` that you maintain with the [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api).

geoControls.description: The network lists you block geographically.

blockedIPNetworkLists.description: The list of networks. To edit the network lists, use the [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api).

networkList.description: The specific network list you specify to block or allow, depending on the method you choose.

ipControls.description: The network lists you block or allow by IP.

allowedIPNetworkLists.description: The list of networks. To edit the network lists, use the [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api).

networkList.description: The specific network list you specify to block or allow, depending on the method you choose.

blockedIPNetworkLists.description: The list of networks. To edit the network lists, use the [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api).

networkList.description: The specific network list you specify to block or allow, depending on the method you choose.

action.description: The action to take on requests from the Donetsk and Luhansk regions of Ukraine  either `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Because this setting is intended to address fluid situations, Akamai will automatically update the included regions as necessary.

put.description: Update the method and which network lists to use for IP/Geo firewall blocking. In Control Center this method is called `mode`. In this API the method is called `blocked`. Use `blockSpecificIPGeo` to block any IPs, geographies, or network lists you choose with this setting. Use `blockAllTrafficExceptAllowedIPs` to allow specific IPs or geographies that you choose to let through while the rest remain blocked. IPs you want to allow are contained in the `allowedIPNetworkLists`. It's important to verify the IPs you block are the ones you intend to block as it's easy to block wanted traffic by accident. Note that subnet controls are a legacy item in Control Center and are not available through this API. _Products:_ All.

block.description: The method by which you block or allow requests by IP or geographic location. In Control Center, this is called `mode`. Use `blockSpecificIPGeo` to block any IPs, subnets, geographies, or network lists you specify. Use `blockAllTrafficExceptAllowedIPs` to allow requests from IPs, subnets, geographies or networks lists in your `blockExceptions` maintained in [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api).

geoControls.description: The network lists you block geographically. Geo network lists are a distinct network list type compared to IP network lists. Use [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api) to manage the network lists.

blockedIPNetworkLists.description: The list of networks. To edit the network lists, use the [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api).

networkList.description: The specific network list you specify to block or allow, depending on the method you choose.

ipControls.description: The network lists you block or allow by IP. IP network lists are a distinct network list type.

allowedIPNetworkLists.description: The list of networks. To edit the network lists, use the [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api).

networkList.description: The specific network list you specify to block or allow, depending on the method you choose.

networkList.description: The specific network list you specify to block or allow, depending on the method you choose.

get.description: Return a list of all malware policies currently in use with the actions each policy takes when conditions are met. _Products:_ All.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully returned active malware policies.

schema.description: Lists details about malware policy actions.

malwarePolicyActions.description: Lists the settings for malware policy actions.

items.description: The actions for a malware policy. Only files up to 5MB are scanned. When files are larger than 5mb, you can set an `unscannedAction`, which is the action you want the network to take for files outside the scan limit.

action.description: The action triggered when malware is found or when there is a content type mismatch, either `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action instead of Akamai's default. Run [Modify a custom deny action](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/put-custom-deny) to manage your custom deny actions. If the action is `none`, the malware policy is inactive in the security configuration.

unscannedAction.description: The action to take when a file is larger than the 5MB scan limit or, in the case of a multipart request, if there are more than 10 files where the total file size exceeds 30 MB. either `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action instead of Akamai's default. Run [Modify a custom deny action](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/put-custom-deny) to manage your custom deny actions. If the action is `none`, the malware policy is inactive in the security configuration.

404.description: [Not found](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/404). The security configuration version or policy wasn't found.

example.detail: The requested resource is not found

put.description: Update the actions in a malware policy. _Products:_ All.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

schema.description: Lists actions you can update for each malware policy.

action.description: Specifies the action the malware policy triggers. Either `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action instead of Akamai's default. Run [Modify a custom deny action](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/put-custom-deny) to manage your custom deny actions.  If the action is `none`, it isn't associated with the policy.

unscannedAction.description: Specifies the action to take when the file is outside the 5MB scan limit. Either `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action instead of Akamai's default. Run [Modify a custom deny action](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/put-custom-deny) to manage your custom deny actions.  When the `action` is `none`, it behaves as if you aren't using malware protections.

get.description: When using Web Application Firewall in your security policy, this mode conveys how you're planning to keep the rules up to date, either `KRS` for manual updates or `AAG` for automatic updates. This operation returns which mode your rules are currently set to. _Products:_ All.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully retrieved the current mode.

schema.description: The GET Response JSON for the security policy mode.

current.description: The current rule set version and the ISO 8601 date the rule set version was introduced. This date acts like a version number.

eval.description: Whether the evaluation mode is enabled or disabled.

evaluating.description: The evaluation rule set version and the ISO 8601 date the evaluation starts.

expires.description: The ISO 8601 time stamp when the evaluation is expiring. This value only appears when `eval` is set to `enabled`.

mode.description: The security policy mode. Use `KRS` to update manually, or `AAG` to update automatically. For Adaptive Security Engine rule sets, use `ASE_AUTO` for automatic updates to the ASE evaluation rules, or `ASE_MANUAL` to manually retrieve current evaluation rules. When not specified, the mode uses default settings. For a KRS 1.0 policy, that means using the KRS 1.0 rule set.

put.description: The mode you set determines how your rule sets are updated. Use `KRS` mode to update the rule sets manually, or `AAG` to have them update automatically. _Products:_ Kona Site Defender, App & API Protector with the Advanced Security module, Adaptive Security Engine.   If you're using Adaptive Security Engine, use `ASE_AUTO` to update the rules automatically, or `ASE_MANUAL` to update them yourself.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

schema.description: The PUT Request JSON for setting the security policy mode.

mode.description: The security policy rule update mode. Use `KRS` to update rules manually, or `AAG` to update rules automatically. For Adaptive Security Engine (ASE), use `ASE_AUTO` for automatic updates or `ASE_MANUAL` to manually get current rules. When switching from one mode to another, any rule actions you have migrate to the new mode. For example, your rule actions for `ASE_AUTO` become the rule actions for `ASE_MANUAL` when you switch from auto to manual modes, and vice versa. Rule actions for `ASE_AUTO` are currently in beta. Contact your account team to access this option.

200.description: Successfully set the security policy mode.

schema.description: The PUT Response JSON for setting the security policy mode.

current.description: The rule set version and the latest version date.

mode.description: The security policy rule update mode. Use `KRS` to update rules manually, or `AAG` to update rules automatically. For Adaptive Security Engine (ASE), use `ASE_AUTO` for automatic updates or `ASE_MANUAL` to manually get current rules.

put.description: Move hostnames you're evaluating to active protection. When you move a hostname from the evaluation hostnames list, it's added to your security policy as a protected hostname. You'll see that hostname in the response object the next time you run [List selected hostnames](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/get-selected-hostnames). _Products:_ Web Application Protector, App & API Protector.
put.summary: Protect evaluation hostnames for a security policy

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

schema.description: Contains a list of evaluation hostnames for the specified configuration version.

items.description: The hostnames on which to match the request.

mode.description: The type of update you want to make to the evaluation hostname list. You can `append` additional hostnames, `remove` hostnames from the list, or `replace` the existing list with the hostnames you pass in your request.

200.description: Successful response.

schema.description: Contains various security policy protections. These settings enable or disable each protection on your policy. However, you set the protections themselves in their corresponding operations available in this API.

applyApiConstraints.description: When enabled, this protection responds to triggers with a specified action.

applyApplicationLayerControls.description: When enabled, your security policy applies the Web Application Firewall controls to your traffic.

applyMalwareControls.description: When enabled, your security policy applies file malware scanning controls to your traffic.

applyNetworkLayerControls.description: When enabled, your security policy applies the network layer control settings to your traffic.

applyRateControls.description: When enabled, your security policy applies the rate control settings to your traffic. Rate controls monitor and flag traffic too fast to be from a human.

applyReputationControls.description: When enabled, your security policy applies the reputation profile settings to your traffic. Reputation profile analyses IP addresses based on their prior interactions with Akamai customers, then alerts on or blocks potentially malicious IP addresses from issuing requests.

applySlowPostControls.description: When enabled, your security policy applies slow POST controls to your traffic.

get.description: Returns a list of all rate policies currently in use with the actions each policy takes when conditions are met. _Products:_ All.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: All the used rate policies for this configuration.

schema.description: Contains details about rate policy actions.

ratePolicies.description: Contains settings for rate policy actions.

ipv4Action.description: The IPv4 action to assign to this rate policy. For `BOTMAN` policies, choose `monitor`, `delay`, `slow`, `deny`,` tarpit`, `none`, or a custom action. For `WAF` policies, choose `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Or use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action to your WAF rate policy. Run [Modify a custom deny action](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/put-custom-deny) to manage your custom deny actions. If the action is `none`, the rate policy is inactive in the policy.

ipv6Action.description: The IPv6 action to assign to this rate policy. For `BOTMAN` policies, specify the same action you chose for `ipv4Action`. For `WAF` policies, choose `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Or use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action to your WAF rate policy. Run [Modify a custom deny action](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/put-custom-deny) to manage your custom deny actions. If the action is `none`, the rate policy is inactive in the policy.

get.description: Returns the action taken for each rule in a policy. The action occurs when the rules are triggered by a request. These are not the same rules as Custom Rules that you configure yourself. These rules are maintained by Akamai. _Products:_ Kona Site Defender, App & API Protector with the Advanced Security module.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully retrieved the rule actions.

schema.description: Describes the members of a rule's actions.

ruleActions.description: The list of rule actions, either `alert`, `deny`, `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}`, or `none`. If the action is `none`, the rule is inactive in the policy.

items.description: The list of rule actions, either `alert`, `deny`, `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}`, or `none`. If the action is `none`, the rule is inactive in the policy.

action.description: The list of rule actions, either `alert`, `deny`, or `none`. Use `deny_custom_{custom_deny_id}` to apply a custom action instead of Akamai's default. Run [Modify a custom deny action](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/put-custom-deny) to manage your custom deny actions. If the action is `none`, the rule is inactive in the policy.

id.description: The unique identifier for each rule.

put.description: Upgrade to the most recent version of the KRS rule set. Akamai periodically updates these rules to keep protections current. However, the rules you use in your security policies do not automatically upgrade to the latest version when setting `mode` to `KRS`. These rules do update automatically when you have `mode` set to `AAG`. Before you upgrade, run [Get upgrade details](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/get-rules-upgrade-details) to see which rules have changed. If you want to test how these rules would operate with live traffic before committing to the upgrade, run them in evaluation mode. This applies to KRS rules only and does not allow you to make any changes to the rules themselves. The response is the same as the `mode` response. _Products:_ Kona Site Defender, App & API Protector with the Advanced Security module, Adaptive Security Engine.  If you're already using or want to switch from KRS to Adaptive Security Engine (ASE), pass `"upgrade": true,` and `"mode": "ASE_AUTO"` or `ASE_MANUAL` in your request. If you're using Kona Rule Sets, continue to pass only the upgrade value. Note that this operation does not grant access to Adaptive Security Engine. It updates the ASE protections if you already have ASE on your contract. Once you switch to ASE protections, you can't go back to KRS rules. Contact your account team if you want to add ASE to your contract.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully updated to latest KRS rule set version.

schema.description: The GET Response JSON for the security policy mode.

current.description: The current rule set version and the ISO 8601 date the rule set version was introduced. This date acts like a version number.

eval.description: Whether the evaluation mode is enabled or disabled.

evaluating.description: The evaluation rule set version and the ISO 8601 date the evaluation starts.

expires.description: The ISO 8601 time stamp when the evaluation is expiring. This value only appears when `eval` is set to `enabled`.

mode.description: The security policy mode. Use `KRS` to update manually, or `AAG` to update automatically. For Adaptive Security Engine rule sets, use `ASE_AUTO` for automatic updates to the ASE evaluation rules, or `ASE_MANUAL` to manually retrieve current evaluation rules. When not specified, the mode uses default settings. For a KRS 1.0 policy, that means using the KRS 1.0 rule set.

get.description: List a KRS rule's conditions and exceptions. _Products:_ Kona Site Defender, App & API Protector with the Advanced Security module.
get.summary: Get the conditions and exceptions of a rule

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully retrieved the rule conditions and exceptions.

schema.description: The GET Response JSON for conditions and exceptions.

advancedExceptions.description: Describes the advanced exception members that allow you to conditionally exclude requests from inspection. This is only available for attack groups and when the advanced exception feature is enabled.

conditionOperator.description: Use `OR` to match any condition, or `AND` to match on all conditions.

conditions.description: The list of match conditions.

items.description: Describes what conditions can be set for an action to occur.

caseSensitive.description: Whether to consider the case-sensitivity of the provided query parameter `value`. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

extensions.description: The file extensions that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `extensionMatch` condition `type`.

filenames.description: The filenames that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `filenameMatch` condition `type`.

header.description: The HTTP header that triggers the condition. This only applies to the `requestHeaderMatch` condition `type`.

hosts.description: The hostnames that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `hostMatch` condition `type`.

ips.description: The IPs that trigger the condition. This only applies to the `ipMatch` condition `type`.

methods.description: The HTTP request methods that trigger the condition. The possible values are `GET`, `POST`, `HEAD`, `PUT`, `DELETE`, `OPTIONS`, `TRACE`, `CONNECT` and `PATCH`. This only applies to the `requestMethodMatch` condition `type`.

name.description: The query parameter name that triggers the condition. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

nameCase.description: Whether to consider the case-sensitivity of the provided query parameter `name`. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

paths.description: The paths that trigger the condition. This only applies to the  `pathMatch` condition `type`.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the condition should trigger on a match (`true`) or a lack of match (`false`).

type.description: The condition type to match on. See [Export condition type values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/etval).

useHeaders.description: Whether the condition should include `X-Forwarded-For` (XFF) header. This only applies to the `ipMatch` condition `type`.

value.description: The query parameter value if the condition `type` is `uriQueryMatch` and header value if the condition `type` is `requestHeaderMatch`. This only applies when the condition `type` is `uriQueryMatch` or `requestHeaderMatch`.

valueCase.description: Whether to consider the case-sensitivity of the provided header `value`. This only applies to the `requestHeaderMatch` condition `type`.

valueWildcard.description: Whether the provided header `value` is a wildcard. This only applies to the `requestHeaderMatch` condition `type`.

wildcard.description: Whether the provided query parameter `value` is a wildcard. This only applies to the `uriQueryMatch` condition `type`.

headerCookieOrParamValues.description: The list of excepted values in headers, cookies, or query parameters.

criteria.description: A list of criteria to limit the scope of this exception.

items.description: The hostname and path criteria to limit the scope of exception.

names.description: The list of excepted names.

paths.description: The list of excepted paths.

values.description: The list of excepted values.

valueWildcard.description: Whether the provided header `name` is a wildcard.

values.description: The list of request attribute names.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNameValue.description: Contains details about the excepted name-value pairs in a request.

criteria.description: A list of criteria to limit the scope of this exception.

items.description: The hostname and path criteria to limit the scope of exception.

names.description: The list of excepted names.

paths.description: The list of excepted paths.

values.description: The list of excepted values.

namesValues.description: A list of name-value pairs to except.

names.description: The list of request attribute names.

values.description: The list of request attribute values.

selector.description: The request attribute to exclude from inspection. See [Exception selector values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/exception-selector-values).

wildcard.description: Whether the provided header `name` is a wildcard.

specificHeaderCookieParamXmlOrJsonNames.description: Describes the advanced exception members that allow you to conditionally exclude requests from inspection. This is only available for attack groups and when the advanced exception feature is enabled.

criteria.description: A list of criteria to limit the scope of this exception.

items.description: The hostname and path criteria to limit the scope of exception.

names.description: The list of excepted names.

paths.description: The list of excepted paths.

values.description: The list of excepted values.

names.description: The list of request attribute names.

exception.description: Describes the exception members that allow you to conditionally exclude requests from inspection.

anyHeaderCookieOrParam.description: The list of request attributes to treat as rule or attack group exceptions. The possible values are `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, and `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header. Use this option if you can't get an exhaustive list of elements to exclude or the list is too large. You can exclude several attributes.

headerCookieOrParamValues.description: The list of excepted values in headers, cookies, or query parameters.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNameValue.description: Contains details about the excepted name-value pair in a request.

name.description: The name of the request attribute.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name-value pair. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

value.description: The value of the request attribute.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamNames.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute name.

names.description: The list of request attribute names.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

specificHeaderCookieOrParamPrefix.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute name prefix.

selector.description: The request attribute that includes the excepted name prefix. Either `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_PAIRS` for a JSON parameter, `XML_PAIRS` for an XML parameter, `ARGS` for a request parameter, or `REQUEST_HEADERS` for a request header.

specificHeaderCookieParamXmlOrJsonNames.description: Contains details about the excepted request attribute names. This is only available for attack groups and when advanced exception is not enabled.

names.description: Lists request attribute names, required with several `selector` options. With `wildcard` enabled, `*` represents a sequence and `?` represents any single character. For example, `*` matches any name, and `*session` matches a subset.

selector.description: The request attribute to exclude from inspection. The following selectors require a set of `names`: `ARGS_NAMES`, `ARGS`, `REQUEST_HEADERS_NAMES`, `REQUEST_HEADERS`, `REQUEST_COOKIES_NAMES`, `REQUEST_COOKIES`, `JSON_NAMES`, `JSON_PAIRS`, and `XML_PAIRS`. See [Exception selector values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/exception-selector-values).

wildcard.description: Whether you can include `*` and `?` as wildcards in any `names`.

put.description: Update a rule's conditions and exceptions. When the conditions are met, the rule's actions are ignored and _not_ applied to that specific traffic. _Products:_ Kona Site Defender, App & API Protector with the Advanced Security module.
put.summary: Modify the conditions and exceptions of a rule

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

get.description: Get slow POST protection settings for a specific policy. _Products:_ All.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully retrieved slow POST protection settings.

schema.description: Contains threshold and action settings for slow POST protection.

action.description: Specifies the  action that the rule should trigger. Either `alert` or `abort`.

durationThreshold.description: If the edge server doesn't receive the first eight kilobytes of the POST body transfer within the specified time, the specified action in the policy is applied.

timeout.description: Number of seconds from the time a request starts to the value specified in the timeout. If the timeout value is reached, the action specified in the policy applies. For example, if the timeout is 30 seconds and a request reaches 30 seconds without completing, the action in the policy triggers.

slowRateThreshold.description: The average rate in bytes per second over a period of time that you specify before an action (`alert` or `abort`) in the policy triggers. For example, if you set the `slowRateThreshold` to an average of 10 bytes per second in a 60 second period and a request comes in at an average of 5 bytes per second in a 60 second period, the action you specified in the policy triggers.

period.description: The slow rate period value. The amount of time in seconds of how long the server should accept a request to determine whether a POST request is too slow.

rate.description: The rate threshold value. How many bytes per second is considered a slow request. For example, 10 bytes or less per second.

get.description: List the evaluation hostnames for a configuration version. Evaluation mode for hostnames is only available for Web Application Protector and App & API Protector. Run hostnames in evaluation mode to see how your configuration settings protect traffic for that hostname before adding a hostname directly to a live configuration. Once you begin, the hostnames you evaluate start responding to traffic as if they are your current hostnames. However, instead of taking an action the evaluation hostnames log which action they would have taken if they were your actively-protected hostnames and not a test. _Products:_ Web Application Protector, App & API Protector.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successful response.

schema.description: Contains a list of evaluation hostnames for the specified configuration version.

items.description: The hostnames on which to match the request.

mode.description: The type of update you want to make to the evaluation hostname list. You can `append` additional hostnames, `remove` hostnames from the list, or `replace` the existing list with the hostnames you pass in your request.

post.description: Creates a new URL protection policy for a specific configuration version. _Products:_ All.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

schema.description: Contains details about a URL protection policy.

apiDefinitions.description: The API endpoints to match on in incoming requests. This only applies to the `api` `matchType`.

definedResources.description: When `true`, match on any resource explicitly added to your API definition without including a `resourceId`. When `false`, you'll need to pass a `resourceId`.

resourceIds.description: The unique identifiers of the endpoint's resources.

undefinedResources.description: When `true`, match on any resource you have not explicitly added to your API definition without including a `resourceId`.  When `false`, you'll need to pass a `resourceId`.

bypassCondition.description: Exempts specific clients from being processed by the URL protection policy.

atomicConditions.description: Specify one or more types of conditions to match on. You can match on client lists, request headers, or both.

oneOf.description: Collects data needed for condition matches on request headers.
oneOf.title: RequestHeaderCondition

className.description: Choose `RequestHeaderCondition` to match a header from the requesting client to the specified header.

name.description: Use `name` to check whether the specified header exists.

nameWildcard.description: Whether to interpret `?` and `*` as wildcards in the specified `name`.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the condition triggers on a match or lack of match.

value.description: A list of unique header values. Use both `value` and `name` to check whether the requesting client's header matches the specified headers.

valueCase.description: Whether to consider case when matching header values, `true` for case-sensitive matches.

valueWildcard.description: Whether to interpret `?` and `*` as wildcards in the specified `value`.

oneOf.description: Collects data needed for condition matches on client lists and network lists.
oneOf.title: NetworkListCondition

checkIps.description: Whether the connecting IP or both the connecting IP and `X-Forwarded-For` (XFF) header match on the client list or network list. URL protection bypass supports `connecting` only.

className.description: Choose `NetworkListCondition` to match the requesting client's identifier, like IP, GEO, ASN or TLS Fingerprint, against the specified client list or network list.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the condition triggers on a match or lack of match.

value.description: Identifies the client list or network list.

categories.description: The traffic categories to perform load shedding on when the origin traffic rate exceeds the load shedding threshold. If `intelligentLoadShedding` is set to `true`, specify one or more categories.

oneOf.description: Defines a `CLIENT_LIST` load shedding category for a URL protection policy.
oneOf.title: urlProtectionCategory

listIds.description: A list of client list identifiers to match on.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the selected client lists match.

type.description: Specify `CLIENT_LIST` to match on a client list.

oneOf.description: Specify one or more load shedding category for the URL protection policy.
oneOf.title: urlProtectionCategory

type.description: Specify the type of traffic to shed first before reaching the requests per second (RPS) limit. `BOTS` includes bots from Akamai's existing list of known bots. `CLIENT_REPUTATIONS` includes traffic from clients with a bad client reputation score. `CLOUD_PROVIDERS` includes traffic from providers like AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud. `PROXIES` includes proxy traffic as determined by IPQualityScore (IPQS) and Akamai EdgeScape. `TOR_EXIT_NODES` includes traffic defined in Akamai's existing network list of nodes.

createDate.description: The timestamp when you created the URL protection policy.

createdBy.description: The username of the person who created the URL protection policy.

description.description: A description of the rate policy.

hostnamePaths.description: The hostname and path combinations to match on.

items.description: The hostname and path combinations to match on.

hostname.description: The hostnames you choose to match on.

paths.description: The list of paths to match on.

intelligentLoadShedding.description: Enable or disable intelligent load shedding. If enabled, traffic that matches the load shedding categories is eligible for shedding if the origin rate exceeds the load shedding threshold.

name.description: The rate policy's unique name.

policyId.description: Uniquely identifies the URL protection policy.

protectionType.description: If matching on `hostnamePaths`, specify `SINGLE` to match on a hostname and path, or `MULTIPLE` to match on hostname and path combinations.

rateThreshold.description: The allowed hits per second during any five-second interval.

sheddingThresholdHitsPerSec.description: Specify the threshold value, in hits per second, after which traffic can be shed. The `sheddingThresholdHitsPerSec` value must be between 70%-90% of the `rateThreshold` value. If you enabled `intelligentLoadShedding`, this value is required.

updateDate.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp when you last updated the URL protection policy.

updatedBy.description: Username who last updated the URL protection policy.

used.description: Whether you're currently using the URL protection policy.

201.description: Successfully created a URL protection policy.

get.description: Returns the specified URL protection policy. _Products:_ All.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Application Security API

200.description: Successfully returned the URL protection policy.

schema.description: Contains details about a URL protection policy.

apiDefinitions.description: The API endpoints to match on in incoming requests. This only applies to the `api` `matchType`.

definedResources.description: When `true`, match on any resource explicitly added to your API definition without including a `resourceId`. When `false`, you'll need to pass a `resourceId`.

resourceIds.description: The unique identifiers of the endpoint's resources.

undefinedResources.description: When `true`, match on any resource you have not explicitly added to your API definition without including a `resourceId`.  When `false`, you'll need to pass a `resourceId`.

bypassCondition.description: Exempts specific clients from being processed by the URL protection policy.

atomicConditions.description: Specify one or more types of conditions to match on. You can match on client lists, request headers, or both.

oneOf.description: Collects data needed for condition matches on request headers.
oneOf.title: RequestHeaderCondition

className.description: Choose `RequestHeaderCondition` to match a header from the requesting client to the specified header.

name.description: Use `name` to check whether the specified header exists.

nameWildcard.description: Whether to interpret `?` and `*` as wildcards in the specified `name`.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the condition triggers on a match or lack of match.

value.description: A list of unique header values. Use both `value` and `name` to check whether the requesting client's header matches the specified headers.

valueCase.description: Whether to consider case when matching header values, `true` for case-sensitive matches.

valueWildcard.description: Whether to interpret `?` and `*` as wildcards in the specified `value`.

oneOf.description: Collects data needed for condition matches on client lists and network lists.
oneOf.title: NetworkListCondition

checkIps.description: Whether the connecting IP or both the connecting IP and `X-Forwarded-For` (XFF) header match on the client list or network list. URL protection bypass supports `connecting` only.

className.description: Choose `NetworkListCondition` to match the requesting client's identifier, like IP, GEO, ASN or TLS Fingerprint, against the specified client list or network list.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the condition triggers on a match or lack of match.

value.description: Identifies the client list or network list.

categories.description: The traffic categories to perform load shedding on when the origin traffic rate exceeds the load shedding threshold. If `intelligentLoadShedding` is set to `true`, specify one or more categories.

oneOf.description: Defines a `CLIENT_LIST` load shedding category for a URL protection policy.
oneOf.title: urlProtectionCategory

listIds.description: A list of client list identifiers to match on.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the selected client lists match.

type.description: Specify `CLIENT_LIST` to match on a client list.

oneOf.description: Specify one or more load shedding category for the URL protection policy.
oneOf.title: urlProtectionCategory

type.description: Specify the type of traffic to shed first before reaching the requests per second (RPS) limit. `BOTS` includes bots from Akamai's existing list of known bots. `CLIENT_REPUTATIONS` includes traffic from clients with a bad client reputation score. `CLOUD_PROVIDERS` includes traffic from providers like AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud. `PROXIES` includes proxy traffic as determined by IPQualityScore (IPQS) and Akamai EdgeScape. `TOR_EXIT_NODES` includes traffic defined in Akamai's existing network list of nodes.

createDate.description: The timestamp when you created the URL protection policy.

createdBy.description: The username of the person who created the URL protection policy.

description.description: A description of the rate policy.

hostnamePaths.description: The hostname and path combinations to match on.

items.description: The hostname and path combinations to match on.

hostname.description: The hostnames you choose to match on.

paths.description: The list of paths to match on.

intelligentLoadShedding.description: Enable or disable intelligent load shedding. If enabled, traffic that matches the load shedding categories is eligible for shedding if the origin rate exceeds the load shedding threshold.

name.description: The rate policy's unique name.

policyId.description: Uniquely identifies the URL protection policy.

protectionType.description: If matching on `hostnamePaths`, specify `SINGLE` to match on a hostname and path, or `MULTIPLE` to match on hostname and path combinations.

rateThreshold.description: The allowed hits per second during any five-second interval.

sheddingThresholdHitsPerSec.description: Specify the threshold value, in hits per second, after which traffic can be shed. The `sheddingThresholdHitsPerSec` value must be between 70%-90% of the `rateThreshold` value. If you enabled `intelligentLoadShedding`, this value is required.

updateDate.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp when you last updated the URL protection policy.

updatedBy.description: Username who last updated the URL protection policy.

used.description: Whether you're currently using the URL protection policy.

403.description: [Forbidden](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/403). You don't have access to the URL protection policy in this security configuration.

example.detail: You do not have the necessary access to perform this operation or the requested resource cannot be modified
example.title: Fobbiden

type.description: The URL for the error type.

get.description: Lists the hostnames for a given contract and group. Use this operation for a new configuration, and use [List selectable hostnames](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/get-selectable-hostnames) to see a list of hostnames you can add to an existing configuration. This operation shows you every acceptable hostname you can use, where the other hostname operation omits any hostnames already included in your configuration. _Products:_ All.
get.summary: List available hostnames for a new configuration

schema.description: Contains the list of hostnames available for protection and its details.

availableSet.description: The available hosts set for the current user.

items.description: Contains details about the hostname and its status.

customRules.name: UXR-715 RE2 Second Test with Flags

customRules.metadata:
<match:variable name="MY_SAMPLE_THREAT_DETECTED" result="true" value="execute rule">
<match:regex impl="re2" regex="^\d+$" result="false" select="REQUEST_HEADERS:Content-Length" strict-err-check-re2="on" transform="urlDecodeUni">
<security:firewall.action>
<msg>UXR-715 CRB Metadata testing</msg>
<tag>CUSTOM/TEST</tag>
<id>667825</id>
<deny>%(WAF_CUSTOM_R667825_DENY)</deny>
<data>threat indicated from data %(MY_SAMPLE_THREAT_DETECTED)</data>
<http-status>403</http-status>
</security:firewall.action>
</match:regex>
</match:variable>

schema.description: Contains details about an exported security configuration version.

advancedOptions.description: The logging and prefetch settings in the configuration version.

items.description: Contains details about the header logging and prefetch settings in the exported configuration version.

logging.description: Contains the configuration version level settings for header logging.

allowSampling.description: Whether you enabled the header data sampling.

cookies.description: The sampling settings for the cookie data.

type.description: The directive for including cookies. Either `all` to include all cookies, `exclude` to exclude specific cookies, `none` not to include any cookies, or `only` to include only specific cookies.

values.description: The cookie names to log or exclude. This applies only when the `type` is either `only` or `exclude`.

customHeaders.description: The sampling settings for the custom headers.

type.description: The directive for including custom headers. Either `all` to include all custom headers, `exclude` to exclude specific custom headers, `none` not to include any custom headers, or `only` to include only specific custom headers.

values.description: The custom headers to log or exclude. This applies only when the `type` is either `only` or `exclude`.

standardHeaders.description: The sampling settings for the standard headers.

type.description: The directive for including standard headers. Either `all` to include all standard headers, `exclude` to exclude specific standard headers, `none` not to include any standard headers, or `only` to include only specific standard headers.

values.description: The standard headers to log or exclude. This is applies only when the `type` is either `only` or `exclude`. For available header values, see [Export header values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/hdval).

pragmaHeader.description: Contains the configuration version level settings for the `Pragma` header.

action.description: The action to perform when a user passes a `Pragma` header. The only action currently supported is `REMOVE`.

conditionOperator.description: Use `OR` to match any condition, or `AND` to match on all conditions.

excludeCondition.description: The conditions to exclude from the default `remove` action. Any condition you set in this object appears in the `Pragma` header debug response object.

header.description: The name of the request header. In the example, `accept`.

name.description: The name of the request header to ignore from inspection. In the example, `type`.

positiveMatch.description: When `true`, matches the selected values. When `false`, matches on anything outside the selected values.

type.description: The header value you want to appear in the response. You can choose from `requestHeaderValueMatch`, `ipMatch`, `networkList`, or `queryParamNameValueMatch`.

useHeaders.description: Whether the condition should include  the `X-Forwarded-For` header (XFF) header. This only applies when the condition `type` is `IP_MATCH` or `NETWORK_LIST`.

value.description: List of header values, query parameter values, IP addresses, or names of network lists. To manage networks lists, use the [Network Lists API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/network-lists/reference/api).

valueCase.description: Whether to consider the case-sensitivity of the provided header value. This only applies when the condition `type` is `REQUEST_HEADER_VALUE_MATCH`.

valueWildcard.description: Whether the provided header value includes wildcards, such as `*` or `?`. This only applies to the `REQUEST_HEADER_VALUE_MATCH` condition type.

prefetch.description: Contains the configuration version level prefetch settings. Use this object to apply application firewall rules and rate controls to prefetch requests.

allExtensions.description: Whether to enable the prefetch settings for all file extensions. This only applies if the `enableAppLayer` member is `true`.

enableAppLayer.description: Whether to enable the application layer rules for the prefetch requests.

enableRateControls.description: Whether to enable the rate controls for the prefetch requests.

extensions.description: The file extensions to apply the settings to. This only applies if the `enableAppLayer` member is `true`.

requestBody.description: Contains the configuration version level settings for request body inspection limit.

requestBodyInspectionLimitInKB.description: Request body size in KB, either `8`, `16`, or `32` as string-formatted integers, or `default` to use Akamai's best practice value.

basedOn.description: The version from which you cloned this version. If it's the first version, this member is omitted from the response.

configName.description: The name that you assign to the security configuration.

createDate.description: The date when you created the security configuration.

createdBy.description: The user who created the configuration version.

customDenyList.description: The list of custom deny actions in the configuration version.

items.description: Contains details about custom deny actions.

ratePolicies.description: A list of custom deny actions in this configuration version.

items.description: Contains details about a custom deny action.

description.description: Describes the custom deny action.

id.description: Uniquely identifies the custom deny action.

name.description: The name you assigned to the custom deny action.

parameters.description: Describes the custom deny parameters.

items.description: Contains a list of parameters for the custom deny action. These parameters are not the same type of parameters you usually include in the path of a request.

displayName.description: The description of the custom deny parameter.

name.description: The custom deny parameter you choose instead of the Akamai default response. For available values, see [Deny name values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/deny-name-values).

value.description: The value you assign to the custom deny parameter. For available values, see [Deny name values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/deny-name-values).

customRules.description: The custom rule details in the configuration version.

items.description: Contains custom rule settings of the exported security configuration.

conditions.description: Contains the details about the condition that triggers the custom rule.

positiveMatch.description: Whether the condition should trigger on a match (`true`) or a lack of match (`false`).

type.description: The type of condition. See [CustomRule condition type values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/condition-type-values).

useXForwardForHeaders.description: Whether the condition includes `X-Forwarded-For` (XFF) header. This only applies when the `type` is `ipAddressMatch`, `geoMatch`, or `asNumberMatch`.

value.description: The value that triggers the condition when matched or not matched. The `value` can either be a string or an array.

oneOf.description: The value that triggers the condition when matched or not matched. The `value` can either be a string or an array.
oneOf.title: Array

oneOf.description: The value that triggers the condition when matched or not matched. The `value` can either be a string or an array.
oneOf.title: String

description.description: The custom rule description.

inspectRequest.description: Whether to inspect the HTTP request for unstructured custom rules.

inspectResponse.description: Whether to inspect the HTTP response for unstructured custom rules.

loggingOptions.description: The specific conditions to be logged.

items.description: Condition to be logged.

id.description: The unique identifier for each logging option. See [Logging option values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/application-security/reference/logging-option-values).

name.description: A description of the logging option type.

value.description: The value on which to match when determining whether to log the custom rule condition.

metadata.description: The metadata you provided for unstructured custom rules.

name.description: The custom rule name.

ruleActivated.description: Whether the rule is active in the configuration.

structured.description: Whether you created the rule with the structured custom rule builder or free-form XML.

tag.description: The list of the labels you assigned to the custom rule.

hostname.description: The hostname unavailable for protection.

reason.description: Describes why WAF can't protect the hostname.

reasonCode.description: The HTTP error code indicating why WAF can't protect the hostname.

evaluating.description: Describes security controls and information for hostnames you want to evaluate.

securityPolicies.description: The evaluation policy details in the configuration version.

items.description: Contains details about the Evaluation Policy settings in the exported configuration version.

effectiveSecurityControls.description: The security controls to apply. For a security control to be effectively turned on, you must enable it in both the match target and the security policy.

applyApplicationLayerControls.description: Whether you enabled application layer controls.

applyBotmanControls.description: Whether you enabled Bot Manager controls.

applyNetworkLayerControls.description: Whether you enabled network layer controls.

applySlowPostControls.description: Whether you enabled slow post controls.

malwarePolicies.description: The malware policy details for a configuration version.

items.description: Contains details about a malware policy.

allowListId.description: The ID of a client list containing file hashes of specific files to allow.

blockListId.description: The ID of a client list containing file hashes of specific files to block.

contentTypes.description: The content types and encodings to match.

encodedContentAttributes.description: An optional list of encoded attribute paths.

encoding.description: The encodings used for the attribute path. Currently only `base64` is supported.

path.description: The JSONPath to an attribute with encoded content. The path must point to a single item, and may not include the `$`, `..`, `?` or `*` operators.

name.description: The name of the content type.

description.description: Descriptive text you provide about a policy.

logFilename.description: Whether to log the name of the file that triggered an `alert` or `deny` action.

name.description: The name you assign to a malware policy.

paths.description: The paths to match. You can use the `?` and `*` wildcards anywhere in a path.

matchTargets.description: The match target details in the configuration version.

items.description: Contains the API and website match targets defined in the security configuration version.

bypassNetworkLists.description: The network lists' identifiers and names in the match target.
